description:
In this role you’ll be responsible for growing organic traffic for Google Cloud emerging business offerings, including Chrome Enterprise, Cloud Identity, Drive Enterprise, and Hangouts Meet hardware, via our online channel. You’ll contribute to the strategy and drive execution to deliver a B2B online experience that serves customers in all segments of the market.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of online/website and product marketing strategy, research or insight generation experience.
  • 2 years of experience marketing B2B cloud computing products/services to developers and business leaders.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Ability to solve problems independently and with innovative approach.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with stakeholders and leverage external agencies/vendors to deliver project outputs.
  • Excellent project management skills, including the ability to prioritize, sequence, execute and deliver projects on time and on budget.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders and represent the team both internally and externally.
responsibilities:
• Manage the growth of Google Cloud Platform products online, by isolating patterns and behaviors to enable customer success.
  • Develop strategies to build on customer-centric growth opportunities.
  • Identify impactful opportunities and resources necessary to execute and lead delivery to achieve key objectives.
  • Partner with research, creative, and engineering teams to ensure execution aligns with strategy.
  • Observe performance of executed work and provide a feedback mechanism that creates a culture of continual improvement.
title: Marketing Manager, Online Growth, Google Cloud
